title: @RiotWrekz
body: Why is it acceptable that Braums Unbreakable allows Vaynes Silver bullets passive to go through it? wouldnt it make sense that this Defender with an ability named Unbreakable actually HAVE an unbreakable shield like was intended? this doesnt fit the lore and making braum negate the W passive on vayne would mean Riot can keep vayne how she is, and braum will have a Slight advantage over a champion that seems to have no counter atm.

replies.body:
Vayne's W passive triggers when she hits people with arrows. Unbreakable still has Braum get hit with an arrow. He blocks it, and hes tough, but hes still getting hit with the arrow. While it doesn't seem like the most favorable interaction with Braum it is true to what is happening in both their abilities.

Vayne could be too strong right now, but there are more direct ways we could look at that.

>Vayne could be too strong right now, but there are more direct ways we could look at that.


***cough*** _move more power from Tumble or Final hour into Condemn_ ***cough***
***cough*** _change bolts from max HP to current HP _***cough***
***cough*** _Remove some AD from Final Hour and replace it with  bonus Magic Resist instead_*** cough***


wheew man... flu season right? haha....

> Remove some AD from Final Hour and replace it with bonus Magic Resist 

What? Why?
Necroposts happen on the boards. We all know that. But normally Rioters know better...

Ok well this was two years ago but i still stand by my claim, Unbreakable is infact not Unbreakable and the only other similar ability would be windwall, and that is simply a gust of wind compared to a magical unbreakable shield backed by muscle. 

Im hoping in the Support Update that Braum will get the Unbreakable ability he deserves given that the game has become a full damage fest. 

And as for vayne's arrows still hitting braum. i think you miss the big picture... Why are the arrows still hitting braum if a giant shield is in the way? that is my arguement.
